verses.verse: Looking up, he saw the rich men putting their gifts into the treasury.
And he also saw a certain poor widow putting in there two mites [copper coins].
He said, "Truly, I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all of them.
"For all these have from their excess put into the offerings of God, but she from her extreme poverty has put in all the living that she had."
As some were speaking about the temple (how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts), he said,
"These things which you see--the days are coming when one stone will not be left on another that will not be thrown down."
So they asked him saying, "Master, when will these things happen, and what sign [will be seen] when these things will happen?"
He replied, "Be alert so that you wouldn't be deceived, for many will come in my name, saying, «I am [Christ],» and the time is getting close, therefore don't follow them.
"But when you will hear about wars and disorders, don't be terrified, for these things must first happen, but the end is not immediately."
Then he said to them, "Nation will rise against nation, kingdom against kingdom,
great earthquakes will happen in various places, terrible epidemics, and terrifying sights will come heaven.
"But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute [you], handing you over to synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and rulers because of my name's sake.
"It will turn out for you for a testimony.
"Therefore settle it in your hearts, not to thing ahead of time what you will answer.
"For I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your enemies will not be able to argue or resist.
"You will be betrayed by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will kill some of you.
"You will be hated by all for my name's sake.
But not a hair of you head will be lost.
"In your patience you gain your souls.
"When you will see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is near.
"Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, and let those who are in the midst of it get out of there, and don't let those in the country go into it [the city].
"For these are the days of vengeance, so that everything which is written may be fulfilled.
"But woe to those who are pregnant and those who are nursing in those days. For there will be great distress in the land and anger on this people.
"They will fall by the edge of the sword, will be led away captive into all nations, and Jerusalem will be trodden down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are completed.
"There will be signs in the sun, the moon, and the stars. On the earth [there will be] distress of nations, with perplexity, for the sea and the roaring waves.
"Men's hearts failing them because of fear and from the expectation of those things which are coming to the earth, for the powers of heaven will be shaken.
"Then will they see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
"When these things start to happen, then look up and lift your heads, for your redemption draws near."
He then spoke a parable to them, "Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
"When they are budding, you see and know in yourselves that summer is near.
"So in the same way, when you see these things happen, know that the Kingdom of God is close at hand.
"Truly, I say to you, «That generation will not pass away until everything is completed.»
"Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
"Be very careful for yourselves lest at any time your hearts be weighed down by over-indulgence, drunkenness, and the worries in this life, and so that day upon you unexpectedly.
"For like a snare it will come on all those who live on the face of the whole world.
"Therefore be watch carefully and always pray that you may be considered worthy to escape these things that will come to pass and to stand before the Son of Man."
In the daytime he was teaching in the Temple, but at night he went out and stayed on the mountain named The Mount of Olives.
All the people came early in the morning to him in the Temple to hear him.
